org.jlinalg
Class Matrix<RE extends IRingElement>

java.lang.Object
  org.jlinalg.Matrix<RE>
Type Parameters:
RE - the type of the elements in the matrix.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComplexMatrix, DiagonalMatrix
public class Matrix<RE extends IRingElement>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class represents a matrix.

Author:
Andreas Keilhauer, Simon D. Levy, Georg Thimm
See Also:
Serialized Form

Returns:
determinant
Throws:

gaussjord

public Matrix<RE> gaussjord()
Returns a matrix that is this Matrix with the Gauss-Jordan algorithm executed on. In other words: It returns the reduced row echelon form of this Matrix. N.B.: In General, this operation will fail, if not all entries are FieldElements.

Returns:
matrix in reduced row-echelon form

gausselim

public Matrix<RE> gausselim()
Returns a matrix that is this Matrix with Gauss-elimination executed on. In other words: It returns a row echelon form of this Matrix. N.B.: In General, this operation will fail, if not all entries are FieldElements.

Returns:
matrix in row-echelon form

eig

public Vector<? extends IRingElement> eig()
                                   throws InvalidOperationException
Calculates the eigenvalues of a matrix.

Returns:
All eigenvalues as a Vector with Complex entries.
Throws:
InvalidOperationException - if this matrix is no square matrix or the entries are not all DoubleWrappers.

hermitian

public Matrix<RE> hermitian()
Returns a matrix that is this Matrix hermitianly transposed. For almost all matrices this method is equivalent to transpose. For matrices with complex elements, use ComplexMatrix

Returns:
hermitianly transposed matrix
Throws:
InvalidOperationException - if the elemnts are of type Complex

Returns:

Returns:
inverse Matrix
Throws:
InvalidOperationException - if the matrix is not square.

public Matrix<RE> and(Matrix<RE> anotherMatrix)

not

public Matrix<RE> not()
Returns the logical negation of this Matrix. Elements of the result are 1 where the matrix is zero, and one elsewhere.

Returns:
Matrix of 1's and 0's

order

public int order(int max)
Calculate the order o of this matrix: the integer number o for which m^o is the identity matrix.

Parameters:
max - The maximal order to test for.
Returns:
  • the order or
  • -1 if the rank is too low or the determinant is not +-1, or
  • -2 if the order exceeds max. This is likely to occur if the elements in this matrix are some sort of floating point.
    Throws:
    InvalidOperationException - if the matrix is not square.

order

public int order()
Returns:
the order of a matrix up to order Integer.MAX_VALUE
See Also:
order(int)
